title.narrative: Sub-Recipients to the Global Fund for HIV, Tuberculosis and Resilient and Sustainable Systems for Health (RSSH) programmes in South Sudan

description.narrative:
Integrating Services for Maximum Impact in South Sudan is a three-year cooperative agreement initiated on January 1, 2021, to provide to provide comprehensive TB and HIV/AIDS, service in 65 Health facilities in South Sudan in Seven states. The Six States covered by the agreement include: Central Equatoria State, Eastern Equatoria State, Western Equatoria, Upper Nile States, Unity State Jonglei State Including the three Administrative areas of Abyei, Ruweng and Pibor.
The Global fund project of the third new funding model (NFM3) has three goals: 1. Reduction of new HIV infections by 50% by 2023 2. Reduction of death among people living with HIV by 50% 3. Reduction of TB incidence by at least 30% (relative to 2019)
This will be made possible by Scaling up of HIV and TB Services through differentiated service delivery strategy and full integration of HIV, TB services and other disease Programmes by ensuring that implementing partners are closely monitored and coordinated with Cordaid and Ministry of Health.

The Global fund project of the third new funding model (NFM3) has three goals: 1. Reduction of new HIV infections by 50% by 2023 2. Reduction of death among people living with HIV by 50% 3. Reduction of TB incidence by at least 30% (relative to 2019)
The project targets to offer HIV and TB service to all generation and population inclusive of gender and age

participating-org.narrative: National Empowerment of Positive Women United

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
